00025 #ifndef _BASE_SVD_

00028 #include <base/base>

00030 #include <base/Matrix>

00033 namespace base {
00034 
00035 #define MAXCONDITION 1e100                      // maximum condition number to return
00036 #define MINSINGVALUE 1e-12                      // minimum singular value before set to 0
00037 
00051 class SVD
00052 {
00053 public:
00054         typedef mtl::rows_type<DenseMatrix>::type RowMatrix;
00055         typedef /*typename*/ RowMatrix::OneDRef RowRef;
00056         typedef mtl::columns_type<DenseMatrix>::type ColMatrix;
00057         typedef /*typename*/ ColMatrix::OneDRef ColRef;
00058         typedef /*typename*/ Matrix::size_type sizet;
00059 
00060         SVD(const Matrix &A);                           // Decompose Matrix A, of M rows and
00061                                                         // N columns, M>=N
00062   
00064         const DenseMatrix &U() const            { return UMat; }
00066         const DenseMatrix &V() const            { return VMat; }
00068         const Vector &diag() const      { return sig; } // vector
00069 
00071         Real condition() const;         // sig_max/sig_min
00072 
00073         Matrix inv() const;                     // pseudo-inverse of A
00074 
00075 private:
00076         sizet M,N;                              // Dimensions of the problem (M>=N)
00077         DenseMatrix UMat;                       // M*M orthogonal matrix U
00078         DenseMatrix VMat;                       // N*N orthogonal matrix V
00079         Vector sig;                             // Vector of N onordered singular
00080                                                 // values
00081 
00082         // Internal procedures used in SVD
00083         inline Real leftHausholder(DenseMatrix &A, sizet i);
00084         inline Real rightHausholder(DenseMatrix &A, sizet i);
00085         double bidiagonalize(Vector &super_diag, const DenseMatrix &_A);
00086 
00087         inline void rotate(DenseMatrix &U, sizet i, sizet j,
00088                 const Real cos_ph, const Real sin_ph);
00089         inline void ripThrough(Vector &super_diag, sizet k, 
00090                 sizet l, const Real eps);
00091         inline sizet getSubmatrixToWorkOn(Vector &super_diag, 
00092                 sizet k, const Real eps);
00093         void diagonalize(Vector  &uper_diag, const Real eps);
00094 };
00095 
00096 
00097 } // base
00098 
00099 /*
00100  *
00101  *                        Numerical Math Package
00102  *
00103  *      Singular Value Decomposition of a rectangular matrix
00104  *                         A = U * Sig * V'
00105  *                      and its applications
00106  *
00107  * In the decomposition above, matrices U and V are orthogonal; matrix
00108  * Sig is a diagonal matrix: its diagonal elements, which are all
00109  * non-negative, are singular values (numbers) of the original matrix A.
00110  * In another interpretation, the singular values are eigenvalues
00111  * of matrix A'A.
00112  *
00113  *
00114  *  Converted to use the MTL math package for LIMP by Valient Gough - 
00115  *      May 22, *  1999
00116  *
00117  *      Taken from the public domain package LinAlg (Numerical Math Class Library)
00118  *
00119  ************************************************************************
00120  */
00121 
00122 
00123 // A class that holds U,V,Sig - the singular
00124 // value decomposition of a matrix
00125 
00126 #endif
